intro: Iridosma, commonly known as the rainbow flower, is a rare and exotic plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, multicolored petals that shift hues depending on light conditions, giving it a mesmerizing visual effect. The plant belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related species, and is known for its intricate floral structure. Iridosma thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained soil to flourish. Due to its unique beauty and limited habitat, it is considered a conservation concern.
